page.title: 03PLANTS CUCKFIELD RURAL
page.content: The soil of this area is a sandstone - clay mixture,it was once covered with deciduous woods but most were cleared in the past for farmland.Landowners are now clearing even more decidous trees and planting conifers,which has quite a marked effect,as coniferous woodland does not support as wide a variety of plant life.There is,however a great deal that is of interest in the hedgerows and woods.As well as the more common wild flowers, including, dandilion, buttercup, daisy,herb robert,plantain and clover, there are several rare plants,Ladies Tresses, Centaury,Yellow wort,Green winged Orchids (Orchis Moria) Butterfly Ochids (Platanthera) and,in a spot known to naturalists and protected by a barbed wire barrier, the last group of Marsh Helliborine (Epipactis Palustris) in the county.
